Ein wunder bares Spiel. Es ist auch relativ simpel wenn man Survivor spielt sollte man am besten nur eine Mechaniker Ausbildung abgeschlossen haben und vielleicht sollte mann noch schneller als Usain Bolt rennen können. Als Killer sollte man am beste irgend was mitnehmen was vielleicht direkt tötet wie zum Beispiel eine geschliffene Axt oder eine Schusswaffe die nicht mit nerf darts schießt. Aber am wichtigsten ist die Überlebenden direkt zu töten und nicht erst dreimal aufhängen. Denn merk dir eins du bist der killer und wenn die Survivor nicht direkt sterben wollen dann starre sie in den Tod.
The story of a perverted farmer and four electric thieves....
一款高画质高代入感的跑酷游戏，拥有数十个翻越地点供玩家使用，玩家通过按住shift+方向键跳过障碍物获得分数。游戏内4个跑酷玩家和一个教练玩家，哪位玩家跑酷过慢则会被教练举高高挂树树所以需要全程奔跑以免被抓，人物触碰电机会被电晕所以需注意远离，同时地图中难以找到的地下室也是玩家喝酒打牌娱乐打闹的欢乐场所。心动不如行动，还在等什么，赶快和你的队友一起尽情享受飞一般的速度和轻松愉快的游戏旅程吧~

Рецепт Пышных оладьев из картофеля и кабачков

ПРОДУКТЫ
Картошка 0.13 кг = 125 г
Кабачок 0.1 кг = 100 г
Яйца 0.5 шт. = 30 г
Пшеничная мука хлебопекарная	1 ст. л. = 25 г
Растительное масло	0.75 ст. л. = 12.75 г
Петрушка  1 веточка = 3 г
Соль  по вкусу
Сахар  по вкусу

Подготовьте все ингредиенты. Из картофеля нужно заранее сделать картофельное пюре.

1
В картофельное пюре добавьте муку и яйцо, все перемешайте

2
Кабачок очистите, натрите и тушите до готовности. Нарежьте петрушку.

3
К картофелю добавьте кабачок и петрушку.

4
Сформируйте из полученной массы оладьи и положите их на разогретую сковородку. Обжарьте с двух сторон до золотистой корочки.

Подавайте со сметаной, предварительно украсив зеленью.

Polecam.
Jest to asymetryczna gra multiplayer w której jedną stroną jest 4 "survivorów" a drugą jeden "killer"
Zadaniem "survivorów" jest naprawienie 5 generatorów i ucieczka.
Zadaniem "killera" jest powstrzymać "survivorów" przed ucieczką.
Gra z czasem bardzo się rozwija. Pojawiają się nowe umiejętności jak i techniki dla "survivorów" jak i dal "killerów".
Powiedziałbym, że jest "easy to learn hard to master".
Polecam kupić na przecenie gdyż by pograć większością survivorów/killerów trzeba trochę się wypłacić na dlc. Gra na przecenie i 2 dlc będzie kosztować coś koło oryginalnej ceny.
Podsumowując polecam.

Genuinely a horrible game. i only ever play it in private lobbies with friends. How people played this game for 3k hours i have no idea. The gameplay is somehow both incredibly shallow and also filled with a ton of little tiny things that build up to be more frustrating than anything else. It's so new player unfriendly i have no idea how they expect anyone to pick this up and play it within 10~ hours.

EDIT: i'm actively angry i spent 11 dollars on this game. you get jack shit for content without the DLC and the killer can just camp if one of the survivors doesn't connect and gets an easy win with no effort.

I wanted to like this game. I really did.

But imagine this: you're a fairly new player, just leveled your first survivor so you can use 4 perks. You ready up.

10 minutes pass before you are in a room. You can't see any details about any other players besides that they are using the pay-to-play characters. OK, fine good on them. All but 1 player readies up, forcing everyone else to wait another minute. Then there's the loading screen. Takes another good 3-4 minutes.

Game starts and things run smoothly. You hop on a generator and 2 survivors join you. Suddenly you hear the heartbeat: the killer came straight to this generator and you've only been in the game 30 seconds! Everyone scatters, but the heartbeat keeps going for you and he catches you easily since he's faster and the absolutely massive hitbox of the weapons make it impossible to juke. There are hooks everywhere, so there is no chance of wiggling free. He hooks you & appears to leave. After about 20 seconds, your teammate shows up and unhooks you. On cue, the killer comes out of nowhere and as soon as the animation ends of you being unhooked, you're on the ground again. He just picks you up and hooks you on the same hook again. Now you're in struggle mode. Finally you get unhooked again and get away. But the killer was still nearby, ignores the player who rescued you and finds you easily from your scratches, blood and moaning. You're down again and hooked for the 3rd time. Now you have to wait for the animation of death to get your embarrassingly low 5000 bp. Checking the scoreboard, all you can see is that it was a tier 3 killer, while you're a tier 20 - completely lopsided. You look at your clock. The game took 4 minutes. 

You waited 15 minutes for a 4 minute game, of which about 30 seconds of was actual playtime. Great.

And this happens every game. Eventually you figure out that the tiny bp consolation prize isn't worth it and you quit before the killer can hook you the 3rd time. They hit you with a temp 5 minute ban for doing it and any bp you would have gotten is lost, but at least you get some small amount of satisfaction out of it. I have pretty much stopped playing survivors now, so I've essentially lost 50% of the game.

At the time I write this, Steam thinks that I have "played" 23 hours. I have actually only played probably 2 hours, if that.
This game should be called Dead by Playtime, since you'll die of old age before you get in a game. 66% of the characters are pay-to-win characters (both in killers and survivors), giving additional overpowered perks to those who want to pay beyond the base game. 

I know the developers won't read this, but on the off-chance they do, here's some suggestions:
- Fix your matchmaker
- Give the killer significant score penalties for completely concentrating on one survivor (for example, if a player is sacrificed before another player has been hooked (or even downed) the sacrifice won't count for the killer AT ALL). This will encourage more active playing from killers.
- Fix your matchmaker
- Increase the camping penalty. Many killers do this. It's not fun for anyone. 
- Break hooks upon rescue. Would prevent killers from killing a player on a single hook and at least give them a chance to escape. The hooks respawn anyways. Maybe there is a perk for this, but it should be baseline functionality.
- Fix your matchmaker

The only reason I won't get a refund is because I got it on sale and I hope that if I check in the future, there will be some balance changes.

---
Ok So I'm re-reviewing this after another 100 hrs. The game does have an extremely steep learning curve, which is especially frustrating when the rank discrepancies grow. I just finished an evening, where every game I had had a level 1-2 ranked red killer and all the survivors were rank 8-12. That's just not fun. Add to that the long queue times, and it becomes downright unpleasant.

So tips for having a good time:
1.) If you are rank 15-20, play no later than 9:30 PM or so. After that the number of people online drops so much that you'll bed put into lobbies with people up to 10 ranks better than you
2.) If you are rank 8-15, play no later than 10:30. That's when the real sweats slither up to their keyboards and the frustrated players start leaving. You'll start seeing at least 1 red rank in every lobby you get in.
3.) If you're 1-8, take some time after 10:30 and do something else like read a book, watch a movie or go to bed.
4.) Once you get 2 games in a row where the other team significantly outranks you, go play something else. It's an indicator that the matchmaker no longer is taking into account ranks properly and is now just feeding newer players to the sweats. Don't be a part of this cycle. Eventually the rank 1s will have to go against each other when there aren't enough "filler" players. Trust me, your sanity and blood pressure will thank you.

Again, devs, if you read this, please reexamine your MM system, You claim that you have millions of players. I'm pretty sure that out of those millions, you can find 5 people of roughly the same skill level and put them into a lobby.
